subject: RE: [junit] Log Messages for Every method
msgSnippet: Hi Kamal, are you sure your log4j-Logger is well configured? First try a system.out.println. If you get the right output, then I certainly suppose, that your
messageBody:
Hi Kamal,

are you sure your log4j-Logger is well configured?

First try a system.out.println. If you get the right
output, then I certainly suppose, that your Logger isn't
well configured.

Martin

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Kamal Ahmed
> Sent: Freitag, 14. März 2008 19:15
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Log Messages for Every method
>
> Hi,
>
> I have a BaseTest Class with the log4j logger as:
>
> protected void setUp() {
>
> sLog.info("Now Running the testcase : " +
> this.getClass().getSimpleName() + "." + this.getName());
>
>
> Now, in the test class, i call :
>
> public void setUp() {
> super.setUp();
>
>
> Now, when i run the testMethod() i SHOULD get a Log4J Logging
> statement on stdout
>
> but, i am not getting Anything, Any ideas?
>
> Thanks,
> -Kamal.
